text:
NAEB COMMITTEES-1959
Executive Committee: William Harley, Stations
WHA-AM-FM-TV, University of Wisconsin, chair¬
man; Graydon Ausmus, Station WUOA, University
of Alabama; Robert Coleman, East Lansing, Mich¬
igan; Keith Engar, Station KUED, University of
Utah; Jack McBride, Station KUON-TV, University
of Nebraska; Robert Schenkkan, Station KUT-FM,
University of Texas.
Awards and Citations Committee: Franklin Dunham,
U. S. Office of Education, chairman; Richard Hull,
Stations WOSU-AM-FM-TV, Ohio State University;
H. B. McCarty, Stations WHA-AM-FM-TV, Uni¬
versity of Wisconsin; Frank Schooley, Stations WILL-
AM-FM-TV, University of Illinois; I. Keith Tyler,
Institute for < Education by Radio-TV, Ohio State
University; Judith Waller, 1515 Davis Street, Evans¬
ton, Illinois.
Constitution Committee: James Miles, Station
WBAA, Purdue University, chairman; Richard Bell,
Arizona State College; Franklin Dunham, U. S. Of¬
fice of Education; Garnet Garrison, University of
Michigan; Armand Hunter, Station WMSB, Michigan
State University; Leonard Marks, Cohn & Marks,
Washington, D. C.
Engineering Committee: Carl Menzer, Stations
WSUI and KSUI, State University of Iowa, chair¬
man; John Brugger, Washington County Public
Schools, Hagerstown, Maryland; Keith Ketchum,
Stations WOI-AM-FM-TV, Iowa State University;
C. E. Phillips, Station WERS, Emerson College;
Fred Remley, TV Center, University of Michigan;
Jack Stiehl, Stations WHA-AM-FM-TV, University
of Wisconsin; and another member to be named.
Finance Committee: William Harley, University of
Wisconsin, Chairman.
Planning Subcommittee: Richard Hull, Stations
WOSU-AM-FM-TV, Ohio State University, chair¬
man; James Miles, Station WBAA, Purdue Univer¬
sity; Frank Schooley, Stations WILL-AM-FM-TV,
University of Illinois.
*
Special Projects Subcommittee: Frank Schooley,
Stations WILL-AM-FM-TV, University of Illinois,
chairman; Richard Hull, Stations WOSU-AM-FM-
TV, Ohio State University; Robert Schenkkan, Sta¬
tion KUT-FM, University of Texas.
Grants-in-Aid Committee: Edward Rosenheim, Jr.,
University of Chicago, chairman; R. Edwin Browne,
Stations KFKU and KANU, University of Kansas;
Larry Frymire, Stations WKAR-AM-FM, Michigan
State University; Harry Lamb, Station WTDS,
Toledo Public Schools; Mrs. Elizabeth Marshall, Sta¬
tion WBEZ, Chicago Board of Education.
Closed Circuit TV Committee: Leslie Greenhill,
Pennsylvania State University, chairman; Neal Bal-
anoff, Stephens College; William Brish, Washington
County Public Schools, Hagerstown, Maryland;
Glenn Macomber, Miami University, Oxford, Ohio;
Miss Wanda Mitchell, Evanston Township High
School; Donald Schein, Mohawk-Hudson Council
on ETV, Schenectady, New York; Glenn Starlin, In¬
ter-Institutional Teaching Project, University of
Oregon.
TV Planning Committee: Jack McBride, Station
KUON-TV, University of Nebraska, chairman;
Franklin Bouswma, Station WTVS, Detroit Educa¬
tional Television Foundation; Richard Burdick, Sta¬
tion WHYY-TV, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Hart¬
ford Gunn, Station WGBH-TV, Boston, Mass¬
achusetts; Keith Nighbert, Station WENH, Univer¬
sity of New Hampshire; Richard Rider, Station
WILL-TV, University of Illinois; John Schwarz-
walder, Station KCTA, Minneapolis-St. Paul; Loren
Stone, Station KCTS, University of Washington.
Radio Planning Committee: Larry Frymire, Stations
WKAR-AM-FM, Michigan State University, chair¬
man; E. G. Burrows, Station WUOM, University of
Michigan; Clifford Eblen, Stations WHA-AM-FM,
University of Wisconsin; Stephen Hathaway, Station
WMUB, Miami University, Oxford, Ohio; Miss Ola
Hiller, Station WFBE, Flint, Michigan; Hugh Mix,
Station WNAD, University of Oklahoma; Len Press,
Station WBKY, University of Kentucky; E. J. Slack,
Station KUSD, University of South Dakota.
JANUARY, 1959
7
